topic.title: "Use Tor meek bridges for tracker connections NO MEEK BRIDGE SUPPORT IN YOUR CLIENT, PLEASE DOWNLOAD THE LATEST BUNDLE." Error
topic.body:
When trying to connect to a lot of new sites i often get this error "Use Tor meek bridges for tracker connections NO MEEK BRIDGE SUPPORT IN YOUR CLIENT, PLEASE DOWNLOAD THE LATEST BUNDLE."
however i am running the most current version of zeronet as far as i can tell. my version number is Version 0.6.4 (rev3688)

topic.title: why does zeronet have trackers?
topic.body: i don't understand what the point of trackers in zeronet are since they centralize data and zeronet worked without them for a long time just fine. Can someone please explain their purpose to me? thanks!

topic.title: Can you run a portable version of Zeronet from a flash drive?
topic.body: i was wondering if zeronet could be run from a flashdrive so that i could keep my site's data and id's while using multiple computers.  also would this affect a zeronet installation already on a computer? I would like to be able to access my zeronet stuff from multiple computers without affecting anything currently on the computer so that no one could know that i was running my zeronet on their computer.

1525203779_1KCJ86Jg3LNBpHxcaRojsHTg9Qme9.body: its saying there are 13 peers but just wont download the zite for me
finally worked for me and its sick.

1527351127_19Qid9uyfWCTmx2cUpDboEKCscRd4.body: i think that the only thing a zeronet user can do about cp is to not seed it.  if you stumble across it remove the zite from ur data folder or block it so that you dont accidentally visit that zite again.  those who wish to view it and make it always will find a way to do so, therefore there is no point in trying to censor it.  its a difficult issue to deal with and given the way zeronet works, there is no way to censor it on this platform

like blazar siad, zeronet is just technology and therefore we shouldnt try to solve pedophilia with it.  Zeronet by its nature is somewhere that pedophiles will congregate but i dont think we should try to remove them from the network because any tool that we can create to remove them will inherently be able to remove anyone else.  If such a tool were even created another problem with it would be who to give it to.  we couldnt let everyone have access to it because then trolls would ban every zite they came across.  whoever is given that power could also troll zites they didnt like or agree with and that would render zeronet useless.  Another problem we have is determining whether child porn is good, bad, or neutral. most people of course would claim that child porn is bad and something that should be eradicated, but pedophiles of course would argue the opposite.  Some people will say that child porn is okay as long as the child is not harmed, or maybe that its okay as long as the child consents to it.  Of course there is no way to prove in a lot of cases whether the child was harmed, physically or mentally, or if they gave consent.  Another problem is how do you identify child porn.  if someone takes a nude selfie the day before their birthday and the day after, the first one is illegal and can result as them being a registered sex offender while the second one is perfectly legal.  How would you determine which picture is the legal one and which one is illegal?  There are of course many other caveats to classifying cp as bad or even classifying something as cp which is the point im trying to make.  It is essentially impossible to ban media that contains nude children or anything else used to classify something as child porn from zeronet.  I think that if you like it then go ahead and seed it and if you dont agree with it then dont seed it.  anything else will just cause a shit storm for the integrity of zeronet.  There is a price to pay for having technology that cannot be censored and that price is that everyone is allowed to do whatever they want, whether or not you agree with it. 
i know some of these points were taken from other people in this thread but i dont know how to quote them and im too lazy to read through everything again to see who said what so please dont be offended if i didnt quote you.
also i love how we can have a normal discussion here as well, without idiots making jokes and completely hijacking the discussion.  its nice to have level headed debates and discussions on the internet.  i want zeronet to become more popular but at the same time i dont because i like these level headed discussions.

> [nicwow](#comment_4_1JHx7fetxzMnUyQ5bUpNLAKAW9VEZdbFMa): I hate posts like these. It would be great if us as a community could report them. If someone's children go on ZeroNet and suddenly see inappropriate content the parents would not be happy. Some option like "censor inappropriate content" is necessary. Not necessarily removing them but removing them from those who don't want this. Preferably set to this by default.

i think we need some sort of tagging system so that people can filter out tags they dont want to see.  this should be implemented on the site level as well as on posts on blogs.  of course this isnt a complete solution because a site owner doesnt have to use the tags but its a step in the right direction.

1561066486_1HiSNH8Uh5LSRjqxtrZrBUEquny9D.body: it is very likely that to sign on to the network, you must use your own account instead of the school giving everyone the wifi password.  If you have a student ID and password that you use to log onto your network it will be very hard to hide your network usage.  Changing your mac address in this case will be of no help to you because even if you use a different mac address every time, they will still associate your account with that mac address.  Once they see that your account is connected, they would then monitor all the traffic from the devices that sign in with your account regardless of their mac addresses.  if you got lucky and you do not have to sign in with your own account, and everyone uses the same information to sign in, then there are ways to hide your network usage.  how do you access zeronet?

> [xcape2net](#comment_18_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): He said in a previous post that he used a local cafe to access zeronet.

ah yes i see that.  also everything you do on zeronet is stored on your computer so zeronet might not be the best thing to have on your computer unless you completely wipe your data folder every time u stop using it.

> [xcape2net](#comment_23_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Laws in the US only help you if you can afford to hire a lawyer.  That's why US schools get away with so much infringement against minors' rights.

a private boarding school has every right to search their student's possessions, even electronic files, because they are not part of the government.  The school can have a policy that states that every student that attends must let the teachers or whoever search their belongings upon request.  If the student does not comply then the school will kick them out.  If a student does not like this policy, then the student can go attend a different school.   The same applies for companies and their policies for cellphone use, searching belongings and many other issues.  A number of companies that i used to work for demanded that cellphones be kept somewhere other than with u while you worked so that you would not be distracted.  I still had access to my phone if i wanted but i couldn't have it on me.  If i didn't like that policy then i could have left the company.  The only exception to this is if you go to a public school or work for the government as the government is not allowed to search or seize your property without a warrant.  This may vary from country to country but thats how it works in the US

> [xcape2net](#comment_41_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Rights get infringed at public schools in the US too.

correct but they aren't supposed to be and there can be legal consequences for that at a public school.  at a private school, they can do whatever they want as long as you agree to it and usually agreeing to all of their policies is a mandatory to attend.  Therefore if you don't want to follow their policies, dont attend that school.

> [gitcentermobile](#comment_13_1BDzk7UPg7TeTu8gdY5eefwKKRyu4yWpXo): Something needs to be done. ZeroNet can't be controlled by nofish only, and we all understand that. Once again, I don't have anything against nofish, the network he created is wonderful and we should remember that. [...]

how do you know that your clones wont get users? I understand that his sites are hard coded but its also extremely hard for any other site besides the hardcoded ones to get users.  this is because in order for someone to know a zite exists, they must have heard about it somewhere.  there is no index of all zites and search engines bust be updated constantly but no one has time for that.  If there was a way to advertise your zites, more people would visit them.  This however does not solve the problem of one person controlling a zite because at least one person will be able to edit anything on a zite unless they throw away their private key but you cant trust that a person has done that, therefore unless you own a zite, it is impossible to trust that the owner is not manipulating its content. I agree that nofish has a lot of control over zeronet, however i think that it is okay because he created it on the principles of freedom from censorship and all the other freedoms zeronet intrinsically has.  If nofish for some reason turns against these principals, zeronet can be rewritten to exclude his zites and the community can still live on.

1572617199_16nArdxrSaNThNp83kL8E6NLL9WD9.body: i dont think that right now they are going to start filtering internet traffic, they are just setting up the framework to be able to do so

i would like to add that if this does have the abilities to protect against a cyberattack as they say it can, that it is a necessary advancement in the era of cyber warfare.  i do believe that there are many ways that this system can be used for censorship however it seems to me that a system like zeronet would still be able to function inside of the splinternet and therefore censorship would be weakened.  if an enemy of the motherland is trying to attack the russians via a electronic medium, being able to shut off that pathway is a critical tool.  Imagine that an attacker based in another country gains control of the electrical grid controls, they would be able to potentially shut down the majority of the russians power.  if the russians had a kill switch, they could immediately cut off the attack and restore power.  even though there is potential for abuse i think a system like that is necessary.  Im not quite sure of the technical aspects of the current system but i hope its actually for defense and not just another censorship tool that they are introducing under the disguise of a national defense mechanism.
